Felix's blog

This blog is about my experiences in software development, I hope you can find something useful!

Table Of Contents

Naming classes how to avoid calling everything a whatevermanager


Try not to create new metaphors (Nanny) Have a look at what other frameworks do Further articles/books on this topic:

What names do you find yourself prepending/appending to classes regularly? What’s the best approach to naming classes? Book: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software (Hardcover) Book: Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture (Hardcover) Book: Implementation Patterns (Paperback)

And a current list of name prefixes/suffixes I collected (subjectively!) from the answers:

  • Coordinator
  • Builder
  • Writer
  • Reader
  • Handler
  • Container
  • Protocol
  • Target
  • Converter
  • Controller
  • View
  • Factory
  • Entity
  • Bucket

And a good tip for the road:

Don’t get naming paralysis. Yes, names are very important but they’re not important enough to waste huge amounts of time on. If you can’t think up a good name in 10 minutes, move on.

Source: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1866794/naming-classes-how-to-avoid-calling-everything-a-whatevermanager
